title: Kilvey Hill Walking Route

images.title: Nigel Davies / Entrance to Kilvey Community Woodland from St. Thomas
images.caption: Kilvey Community Woodland entrance. Described as: "This entrance allows access to Kilvey Hill from the south. The woodland is owned by the Forestry Commission but is named as a community wood."

images.title: Nigel Davies / Swansea SA1 from Kilvey Hill
images.caption: Swansea SA1 from Kilvey Hill. The hill affords some great views of Swansea. Looking south here we see the two piers that form the mouth of the river Tawe running out towards the horizon. Just in front of them are the basins of Swansea Docks, around which there is much redevelopment under the banner of the "SA1" project.

images.title: Nigel Davies / Windmill Ruin on Kilvey Hill
images.caption: Windmill Ruin on Kilvey Hill

images.title: Nigel Davies / Kilvey Hill Transmitters
images.caption: Kilvey Hill Transmitters. Kilvey Hill lies to the easy of Swansea, just across the river Tawe from the city centre, and can be seen from all over the city.

images.title: Pond behind dam in Kilvey Hill Community Woodland by Nigel Davies, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pond behind dam in Kilvey Hill Community Woodland. The pond is located north of the hill in the woodland area.

images.title: Summit Shelter on Kilvey Hill by Nigel Davies, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Stone summit Shelter at the summit

description: This circular walk climbs to the Kilvey Hill viewpoint in Swansea . The hill is located on the south eastern side of the city, near to the docks. There's some fine views and peaceful community woodland trails to enjoy in this area. You can start the walk near Jersey park, on Harbour View Road. From here you can pick up woodland footpaths heading east and then north up to the hill top which stands at a height of 193 metres (633 ft). From here there are excellent views of the city centre, the docks, Swansea Bay, and Port Talbot . At the summit you'll also find an old ruined windmill, a TV transmitter station and a telecommunications mast. After taking in the views you can descend on alternative paths in the community woodland area to the south of the hill.
